controller

Class Boundary

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • controller.Boundary
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Boundary
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class handles keyboard input for a console application.
    Author:
    Jens Werner Nielsen (s123115).

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> cache

        MAX_PRIORITY, MIN_PRIORITY, NORM_PRIORITY

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Boundary()
      When this class gets initialized it starts a background thread that caches the keyboard input.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Boundary

        public Boundary()
        When this class gets initialized it starts a background thread that caches the keyboard input.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        This function closes the background thread. Please note that the thread will continue to run until the current line is finished.

      • run

        public void run()
        This function contains the code for the background thread.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString(java.lang.String prefix)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This function reads a line with a specific prefix from the cache.
        Parameters:
        prefix - This parameter is a regex pattern the line must begin with. All other lines are ignored.
        Returns:
        The oldest line that has the right prefix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If close() is called while waiting on input from the user.

      • readInt

        public int readInt(java.lang.String prefix,
          int minimum,
          int maximum)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        This function reads an integer with a specific prefix from the cache.
        Parameters:
        prefix - This parameter is a regex pattern the line must begin with. All other lines are ignored.
        minimum - This parameter specifies the minimum value accepted.
        maximum - This parameter specifies the maximum value accepted.
        Returns:
        The oldest integer that has the right prefix and are within the specified boundaries.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If close() is called while waiting on input from the user.

      • readDouble

        public double readDouble(java.lang.String prefix,
                double minimum,
                double maximum)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This function reads a double with a specific prefix from the cache.
        Parameters:
        prefix - This parameter is a regex pattern the line must begin with. All other lines are ignored.
        minimum - This parameter specifies the minimum value accepted.
        maximum - This parameter specifies the maximum value accepted.
        Returns:
        The oldest double that has the right prefix and are within the specified boundaries.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If close() is called while waiting on input from the user.
